intro: Lithocardium trichostemon, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and is adapted to survive in dry conditions with a deep root system. It produces a capsule-like fruit that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. Lithocardium trichostemon is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is an important component of local flora in its habitat.
